This is due to an inversion and stagnant air conditions near the surface that will continue to trap pollutants. Air quality...

entry.title: MARTIN LUTHER KING JR. HOLIDAY MEANS CLOSURES
entry.summary: January 19l 2026 3:40 a.m. Monday is the Martin Luther King Jr. holiday and that means there are a number of closures. Federal, state, county and city offices are not open. Regular mail will not be delivered. School is not in session. Banks and credit unions are closed. Many professional offices will be shuttered. Most...

entry.title: COW CREEK UMPQUA INDIAN FOUNDATION GRANTS $795,000 TO NON-PROFITS
entry.summary: January 19, 2026 3:20 a.m. On Thursday, the Cow Creek Umpqua Indian Foundation celebrated its winter awards ceremony at Seven Feathers Casino Resort. A foundation release said $759,930 was distributed to southern Oregon non-profit organizations that work to strengthen their communities. The grants were awarded to groups in Douglas, Jackson, Josephine, Coos, Klamath, Lane and...

entry.title: AUDUBON SOCIETY/ROSEBURG LIBRARY TO HOST GREAT HORNED OWL PRESENTATION
entry.summary: January 19, 2026 3:05 a.m. The Umpqua Valley Audubon and Roseburg Public Library invite the public to a presentation on great horned owls, by Colorado researcher Scott Rashid. On Wednesday, January 28th at 6:00 p.m. Rashid will visit virtually on Zoom. Attendees are invited to participate in person at the library on Northeast Diamond Lake...

entry.title: CITY OF ROSEBURG WITH COMMISSION VACANCIES
entry.summary: January 19, 2026 2:50 a.m. The City of Roseburg has vacancies on three city commissions and is now accepting applications from those interested in serving. A city release said the Budget Committee, Homeless Commission and Public Works Commission all have openings. The application for the Budget Committee is March 13th. Applications for the other commission...

entry.title: Cow Creek Umpqua Indian Foundation Awards $759,930 to 93 Southern Oregon Nonprofits
entry.summary: The Cow Creek Umpqua Indian Foundation awarded $759,930 in grants to 93 nonprofit organizations across seven Southern Oregon counties during its winter awards ceremony at Seven Feathers Casino Resort. Total giving since 1997 is now $27.2 million.

entry.title: DENSE FOG ADVISORY FOR CENTRAL DOUGLAS COUNTY UNTIL 12:00 P.M. MONDAY
entry.summary: January 18, 2026 1:50 p.m. A Dense Fog Advisory is in effect until 12:00 p.m. Monday for central Douglas County. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said visibility of one quarter of a mile or less in dense fog, especially over elevated roads is expected. Forecasters said low visibility could make driving conditions hazardous.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 01.16.26
entry.summary: Melody Schwegel of Umpqua Actors Community Theatre talks about the Father Daughter Dance in February, and the upcoming production of Sweeney Todd. In the second segment, Ashley Cluver of Umpqua Valley Art has an update on their new schedule, the new exhibits and upcoming classes.

entry.title: Round Table Pizza Set to Return to Roseburg This Spring
entry.summary: Round Table Pizza is set to return to Roseburg this spring at 2040 NW Stewart Pkwy. FAT Brands confirmed the comeback and says the location plans to hire 25 employees. An exact opening date has not been announced.

entry.title: Fatal Crash on Elkhead Road Near Drain Under Investigation
entry.summary: Douglas County deputies are investigating a fatal two-vehicle crash on Elkhead Road near Drain early Jan. 14. An 89-year-old driver passed away at the scene. A 72-year-old driver was injured and taken to Mercy Medical Center. No intoxicants suspected.

entry.title: Roseburg seeks applicants for three different commissions
entry.summary: The city of Roseburg is seeking qualified applicants for the Roseburg Budget Committee, Roseburg Homeless Commission and Roseburg Public Works Commission.

entry.title: Police Log: January 15, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police reported multiple enforcement actions on Jan. 15, including warrant and parole violation arrests, a DUII citation following a domestic dispute call, and enforcement activity in city parks, according to the department’s daily activity logs.

entry.title: County government offices closed for Martin Luther King Jr. Day
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — Douglas County government offices will be closed Monday, Jan. 19, in observance of Martin Luther King Jr. Day.

entry.title: Wildlife Safari Offers Free Admission for Douglas County Appreciation Days Jan. 18–19
entry.summary: Wildlife Safari is hosting Douglas County Appreciation Days Jan. 18 and 19, offering free drive-through admission for county residents with valid ID. Discounts on encounters, memberships, plushies, retail, and food will also be available, along with keeper chats.

entry.title: C&K Market to Close Drain Ray’s Food Place in Late February
entry.summary: C&K Market announced it will close Ray’s Food Place in Drain in late February after “careful consideration.” The employee-owned company said all staff will be offered jobs at other locations, and gift cards and loyalty rewards will remain valid at all Ray’s stores.

entry.title: REPUBLICANS SAY LEGISLATURE CANNOT REPEAL REFERRED TRANSPORTATION TAX: 1935 AG OPINION
entry.summary: January 16, 2026 6:20 a.m. Republican legislative leaders say a 1935 Oregon Attorney General opinion confirms that once Oregonians invoke their constitutional right to referendum, the legislature has no authority to repeal the measure before voters have their say. The lawmakers said the precedent directly contradicts Governor Tina Kotek’s recent call for lawmakers to repeal...

entry.title: Roseburg Schools hosts early literacy event Jan. 26
entry.summary: Roseburg Schools continues the effort to enhance literacy development across the community with an early childhood literacy event on Jan. 26.

entry.summary: January 16, 2026 4:10 a.m. Roseburg tied the record lowest high temperature for January 15th on Thursday. entry.title: Umpqua River Lighthouse to Celebrate 132nd Birthday with Open House on Jan. 17
entry.summary: Celebrate the Umpqua River Lighthouse’s 132nd birthday at a free open house Saturday, Jan. 17, 2026, from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. in Winchester Bay. Enjoy refreshments and cake, tour the lighthouse from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m., and explore the museum, gallery, and gift shop.

entry.title: CCD Business Development Corporation hosts cybersecurity talk for small business owners
entry.summary: It is a small business owner’s worst nightmare: a single click on an unfamiliar link in a text message or email and suddenly all of their private data is accessed, leaving all their had work vulnerable to collapse.

entry.title: A healthier Douglas County: The past, present and future of Thrive Umpqua
entry.summary: In 2017, Blue Zones Project-Umpqua was formed to inspire healthier and more active living in a county struggling with maintaining healthy behavior among its residents.
